user_resources.name: WordPress site
user_resources.description: clarksvillewedding.com staging site with Divi, GeoDirectory ready

user_resources.name: Fixed parameter parsing
user_resources.description: wp-mcp tool now handles complex JSON parameters correctly

six_hat_analysis.white: Facts: wp-mcp tool is now functional with fixed JSON parameter parsing. EventPros.com requires 4 phases: B (location hierarchy, CPTs, categories), C (import 276 business listings), D (Divi theme/templates), E (SEO optimization). WordPress site has Divi 4.27.4 and GeoDirectory active. Configuration files and CSV data are ready. Phase A (environment) is 100% complete.
six_hat_analysis.red: Excitement: The parameter parsing fix was the key blocker - now we can execute the complete EventPros automation pipeline. There's anticipation about seeing all 276 business listings properly imported and the professional directory site come to life. Some concern about ensuring data quality and proper field mapping during CSV import.
six_hat_analysis.black: Risks: Large CSV imports (276 records) could timeout or fail partway through. Complex JSON configurations might still have edge cases. WordPress site could have permission issues. Divi template creation might not work perfectly. Need to ensure no data corruption during bulk operations.
six_hat_analysis.yellow: Benefits: Complete EventPros.com automation will demonstrate the full power of the wp-mcp system. Professional directory site will be 100% functional with real business data. All phases working together creates a replicable pattern for other directory projects. Success means zero manual intervention needed.
six_hat_analysis.green: Alternatives: Could batch the CSV imports in smaller chunks to avoid timeouts. Could validate each phase before proceeding to next. Could create backup points between phases. Could use the complete setup handler for streamlined execution.
six_hat_analysis.blue: Process: Execute phases sequentially B→C→D→E, validating success after each. Use the configuration files and CSV data systematically. Test core functionality after each major phase. Provide detailed status reporting throughout execution.

data.denoised_plan: Execute complete EventPros.com implementation using the now-functional wp-mcp tool. Strategy: Sequential execution of Phases B→C→D→E with validation after each phase. Use configuration files and CSV data systematically to build a professional directory site with 276 business listings across 10 cities. Mitigate risks by using smaller batch sizes for imports and validating each step. Goal is 100% automation with zero manual intervention, demonstrating the full power of the wp-mcp system for directory site deployment.
